page.title: 09QUARRIES IN RATHO
page.content: ONE BLAST PRODUCES ABOUT 1800 TONES OF ROCK. THE SMALLER ROCKS ARE LOADED BY A DIGGER ON TO DUMP TRUCKS AND TAKEN TO THE CRUSHING PLANT. LARGER ROCKS ARE BROKEN UP BY DROPPING A FOUR TON STEEL BALL FROM A HEIGHT OF ABOUT TWENTY METRES. AT THE CRUSHING PLANT THE ROCKS ARE CRUSHED AND THEN GRADED ACCORDING TO SIZE. THE SIZES GO FROM 12" DOWN TO DUST. FOSSILS HAVE ONLY BEEN FOUND IN THE TOPSOIL WHICH WAS STRIPPED OFF THE SURFACE AS THE BASALT IS A VOLCANIC ROCK AND NOT GOOD FOR FINDING FOSSILS IN. THE ONLY VALUABLE MINERAL FOUND HERE IS FOOLS GOLD. THE STONE IS TRANSPORTED IN A FLEET OF LORRIES TO EDINBURGH AND LIVINGSTON FOR THE MAKING OF ROADS. WHEN THE QUARRY STARTED THE CANAL WAS THE METHOD BY WHICH THE STONE WAS TRANSPORTED AWAY FROM THE QUARRY.
